text: New: Dusty May is a coal miner's son but a mama's boy at heart. How he went from the remote rolling hills of rural Indiana to the breakout star coach of college basketball.
I think we can applaud Patrick Cantlay finishing his round. Ahem.
Get the Dad Bod Cut green jacket ready for Jon Rahm. This Masters is over.

Phil's 65 matches his career-low in 114 rounds played at Augusta. The only other time he shot 65 was in the first round -- in 1996, when Greg Norman shot 63 and Phil finished third behind Faldo and Norman. Phil last shot as low as 66 in 2012. #themasters
Clippers joining the T-Wolves on the NBA’s Hate Your Teammate Easter Sunday.

It's honestly difficult to fathom the timeline of Phil Mickelson's career path over the past 18 months. So many twists and turns. But consider this: A year ago, he decided to skip the Masters because he was busy disrupting professional golf and now he's the clubhouse leader.
A 65. Wild.
Quite the warlock round from Phil.
It’s been about an eon since Brooks Koepka was 12 under and rolling.
Not on Easter, T-Wolves.
Sam Bennett, way to be the column today at Augusta. What a story.
Condolences to the Hahn family. Had most recently been right-hand man to Bob Huggins at WVU.
Some changes recommended for the D1 football recruiting calendar:
The portal giveth and the portal taketh in Ann Arbor. Caleb Love to Michigan.
Men's basketball committee turnover: Bradley AD Chris Reynolds and A-10 commissioner Bernadette McGlade coming off; Temple AD Arthur Johnson and Saint Peter's AD Rachelle Paul going on.

New pod . Angel Reese vs Jill Biden with the Obamas thrown in for artistic effect. Funding Olympic sports vs football growth. Braylon Edwards torches Ohio State. Fish assault. Snakes on a plane. @DanWetzel @RossDellenger @SandersonRadio
If for some reason you actually want to *watch* three sketchy dudes podcast, we are now on YouTube:
Max Homa live, interesting.
Kudos to amateur Sam Bennett on being -4 through 11. But if the Augusta honchos see the video of him spitting behind the 12th green they may terminate his round.
Presented without comment. Or apology. @ChrisVernonShow @Jon_Roser
A 65 with a first-hole four-jack. You crazy, Jon Rahm.
Tiger persevered. He doesn't have to keep playing for anyone but himself, but I'm always willing to watch him.
Vik with the flat stick. Great round.

Everything you need to know about the city/viewing area that cares most about men's college hoops. Louisville was atrocious and Kentucky was out of the tourney after the first weekend. Still posted the top ratings.
text
That sequence was a pity second-half summation: turnover, turnover, airball three, offensive foul.
Dan Hurley to his team: "Wake up! Wake up!"

San Diego State was down 14 Saturday vs. FAU. Down eight to Creighton. Down nine to Alabama. Deficit reached 16 in the first half tonight. This is a much harder hill to climb, but the Aztecs will try.
UConn 36, SDSU 24 at half. Not unanticipated, and it could have been worse for the Aztecs if not for a late couple baskets.
Andre Jackson with the sorcery assist to Joey California. UConn is rolling again.
Mensah, LeDee and Arop are a combined 0-for-8 for SDSU. They're all paint players, and they cannot get anything against UConn's height.
UConn now on a 16-2 run. Aztecs haven't made a field goal in a loooong time. SDSU isn't rattled playing from behind, but UConn is a different deal.
SDSU has missed eight straight shots and is being dwarfed in the paint on offense.
SDSU shoots 34.3 percent from three and 48.8 percent from two on the year. So far: 66.7 from both.
If San Diego State is going to shoot like this ....
Let’s go
One hour until tipoff. One more chance to catch up on your pregame reading. Column on Danny Hurley's turn to extend the family basketball dynasty
Column on the unique place in Final Four lore now occupied by Lamont Butler and his shot Saturday night:
Column on Lamont Butler's epic moment, and the memory of his slain sister.
Column on Lamont Butler's immortal play, and who he plays for:
That was a, um, dramatic moment from Weatherspoon.
Dead ball technical foul on Micah Parrish.
Love you, Hoops.
FAU's speed and skill is so impressive up close. They just have so many guys who can handle, pass, drive and shoot.
Owls are so very much ready for this moment. FAU up 40-33 at halftime, shooting 54 percent from the field.
Also worth noting: SDSU was down nine in the second half to Alabama and down seven in the second half to Creighton. Aztecs aren't going to panic in this spot.
FAU is slicing up what Ken Pomeroy rates as the No. 4 defense in the nation. Getting good shots, and making them.
Got my hands on that loose ball that went off-court. My first contribution of the night.
This is a great freaking game so far.
Making shots, sharp pace. Not at all the rock fight it was anticipated to be.
Well, the stadium shooting background is just fine so far. Teams a combined 6-11 from three.
Nick Boyd vs. Matt Bradley in a three-point contest. Each has made three of them.
Matt Bradley hadn't made a three since the first game of this tournament. A very welcome sight for SDSU to see him knock down two early.

One more pregame push for this story on Dusty May: a coal miner's son who nearly didn't make it out of ICU as a preemie with collapsed lungs; the first from his family to get a four-year degree; now the hottest coach in college basketball.
Students singing the anthem. A great Final Four tradition.
Well that was a fun half. But Alijah Boston is coming back now.
Caitlin Clark stop it
Column: on Jim Larranaga, 73-year-old cutting edge college basketball coach.

Before FAU’s March Madness run, the Owls collective had zero NIL dollars. In the last 3 days, it has raised $65,000. In the NIL Era, the spoils of Cinderella are no longer only relegated to coaching bonuses & school donations. It means cash to athletes.
The pitch clock is working great. Just don’t call it that.
Miami’s Jim Larranaga here at the Final Four: “Let’s expand the NCAA Tournament to at least 96 teams.” Love ya, Jim, but let’s not.

pod is live Congressional NIL hearing is a total mess. Does the Final Four finally earn San Diego State an invite to Pac 12 (or Big 12)? Is B12 looking at Fresno? Mr. Ugly contest. Cheating fisherman. @RossDellenger @ByPatForde @SandersonRadio
Definitely closer to roots and to home. And VCU is a good job. But he’s also moving from what has been a four-bid league the past two seasons to what was a one-bid league this year.
NCAA president Charlie Baker’s statement on today’s NIL hearing
We do need guardrails after all. For the legislators.

We are halfway to an all-Conference USA NIT final after North Texas beat Wisconsin. UAB currently up eight in the first half on Utah Valley. Combine that with FAU's Final Four and Charlotte's CBI title, and CUSA is ... 15-0 in tournament play. And counting.
Update and correction: UAB won to set up the all-CUSA final. But Rice went 1-1 in the CBI so the league’s tournament record is 17-1. Still super-strong.
Unreal. The three-woman battle in that race between McIntosh, Titmus and Ledecky is now probably the marquee event in the sport.
Kalkbrenner hook and hold? Mensah was calling for the review.

When the teams are a combined 5-23 from three, it's going to become an inside brawl. Both teams going to the paint and to the glass with maximum intensity. SDSU has 10 offensive boards in the last 11/2 minutes of game time.
Dutcher going with a tenuous offensive lineup here. See how this goes down four.
Two points in 4:11 for Creighton this half. Had a couple threes spin out. Bluejays are just 2-11 from three.

Creighton up five at half. San Diego State had zero offensive rebounds in the first 17 minutes, ended the half with five. Aztecs don't make many shots, so getting second chances and winning a war of attrition is probably their best chance.
I'm always open and my range starts when I enter the gym.
That was actually @PeteThamel and I discussing Jaeden LeDee's jump shot form.
Creighton shooting 67 percent inside the arc so far, against a team that holds opponents to 49.3 percent. Bluejays putting in the work to get good shots.
Darrion Trammell has been the We Really Need A Basket dude for SDSU here in Louisville.
The Jaeden LeDee-centric offense is not a good offense for SDSU.
Nearly a full line change for SDSU out of the first media timeout. Definitely going to use their depth to their advantage.
The column from San Diego State's takedown of No. 1 Alabama:
Here is @CBB_Central on the end of the road for Gonzaga and Drew Timme, and perhaps the end of an era.
And the original 1-68 NCAA Tournament rankings. Indicative of what kind of tourney it's been: the remaining teams are Nos. 4, 13, 18, 20, 22 and 31.

Happy Elite Eight Sunday. Two more Final Four berths earned today: Texas-Miami for one, and San Diego State-Creighton for the other. I will be at the latter game. Some pregame reading linkage to follow ...
With Alabama out, the left side of the bracket is wide open. FAU vs. Kansas State right now for one Final Four spot.
Ninety minutes before tipoff of the first regional final tonight. How is the 1-16 re-rank of the Sweet Sixteen holding up? About like everyone's brackets.
Finally got around to watching @ASUSwimDive 's Leon Marchand massacre of the NCAA 400 IM record. Speechless.
Column: Alabama ran into the wrong team at the wrong time.

Saturday: UConn-Gonzaga and K-State-FAU for the Final Four. Sunday: Creighton-San Diego State and Texas-Miami for the Final Four. Total combined national titles of the eight remaining programs: four, all UConn's.
Does Princeton have a last stand in it? Down nine at the final media timeout. A 1-3-1 zone has helped bring the Tigers back. Stay tuned.
We are done here, I believe.
Princeton has a band Santa. College sports.
Alabama. Gone.
Mark Sears, Ohio transfer, keeping Alabama alive. Scored seven straight Bama points.
LeDee: 77 percent from the line.
SDSU will have to handle the ball vs full court pressure for 74 seconds to get out of here with this massive upset.
San Diego State has been money on BLOB plays. Except that last one, didn't love the jump shot. Up seven with the ball, 2:18 left.
The overall No. 1 seed is down three possessions with 3:51 left. SDSU ball. Alabama clearly feeling the pressure and Aztecs are very confident right now.
Brandon Miller: 3-16 from the field, six turnovers.
A column on delightful Princeton, which keeps winning despite numerous modern college basketball disadvantages.
Swimming tweet: Anyone else not getting the ESPN+ live feed from NCAA men’s championships yet?
If Leon Marchand is going to go extra terrestrial in the 400 IM today, I’d like to be able to see it.
And a column on Princeton: A Cinderella that was not built for this era of college basketball, but is thriving in it nonetheless
Can Princeton continue their historic run of upsets? Will Miami get past Houston? @ByPatForde reveals four underdogs that will cover the spread in the Sweet 16
Two Sweet Sixteen classics FAU to the eight UConn steamroller March.
THE WORST BEST SHOT EVER
They ran the Villanova play with 8 SECONDS LEFT
Another absolute classic for Gonzaga-UCLA
Some 2006 flashbacks for Zaga-UCLA
Drew Timme. Monster. Doesn’t want his 23-year college career to end.
Maybe there wasn’t any bias involved in putting Tennessee 15th out of 16.
HOOT
Let the little man cook …

Spoke to Jerome Tang about this after the game: this wasn't a dummy call or a fake out. Tang was calling one thing and Nowell was calling something else. Nowell noticed Johnson out of the corner of his eye and threw the alley oop because of their connection.
Column: A lot has happened since the @SINow 1-68 pre-tournament rankings came out. Here's the new ranking, 1-16, heading into the second week of the NCAA Tournament:
Column: Rick Pitino can thank Iona for the reputation rinse on his way to St. John's, his latest Last Job He'll Ever Have.
Rick Pitino on SportsCenter today: “I’ve always run a clean program.”
Paul Mills met with his Oral Roberts team a few minutes ago and informed the players he is taking the Wichita State job, via a source close to the team
The @ORUMBB will be looking for a new head. Can confirm that Paul Mills will be the next Head Coach at @GoShockersMBB .
In the past few years, Aaron Rodgers was pretty clearly searching for something. Now he is likely headed to New York, and might not like what he discovers there, writes @Rosenberg_Mike

The world continues to spin quickly around Fairleigh Dickinson basketball: after making history on the court and losing coach Tobin Anderson to Iona, FDU has elevated assistant Jack Castleberry to head coach.
A great choice:

pod is live NCAA Opening Weekend Recap. Why so many upsets? Purdue falls. Kentucky and Duke too. Shirtless Muss. Who can beat Bama? Matt Damon as Sonny Vaccaro. Bail Bond NIL. A very, very old clam. @RossDellenger @ByPatForde @SandersonRadio
BREAKING: Rick Pitino will meet soon with his Iona basketball team and will become the next coach at St. John's, a source told @TheAthleticCBB
Sweet Sixteen overview column: the remaining field reflects jumbled diversity of the season. Eleven conferences, just one coach who has won it all … and some really old players.
Saturday overnight column on Houston, facing a set of adverse circumstances and powerfully responding to slow down what had been a big day for the SEC.
And a quick-turn Sunday night column on Tom Izzo. He’s doing great things in March as always, but his most valuable work for Michigan State this year was in February.
Column: The bracket was busting, the SEC was dominating, Houston was staggering ... and then the Cougars showed what they're made of with 20 dominant minutes in a hostile atmosphere.
This is the quest Houston kept alive last night, trying to finally win a title in its own backyard.

Congrats to @stanfordwswim on another top three finish at NCAA championships. Kudos to Virginia on winning the title and specifically Kate Douglass on ending her college career with a spectacular meet.
Awesome. His first state tourney was in 1948.
Alabama 52, Maryland 35. We're done here.
And that's why Alabama wants Brandon Miller in the lineup. Soaring block at one end, transition three at the other.
Noah Clowney, who tweaked something late in the first half, is trying to stretch out at halftime but might not be able to go this half.
Clowney is starting this half.
Maryland was on the ropes down nine, cuts it to five at halftime. They're outmanned, but the Terrapins are making Bama work for it.
Miller starting to get going. He's up to seven points and Alabama leads by four. The building is very loud right now.
Julian Reese has three fouls for Maryland, which is a major concern given the interior challenges Alabama presents.
In keeping with recent tournament events: Maryland 12, Alabama 10.
Brandon Miller still has not made a field goal in the NCAA Tournament. He was scoreless Thursday and has missed all three of his FGs today. Has made two FTs though.

Appreciate the antics or don’t, but Eric Musselman is proving himself to be an elite tournament coach. Another masterclass tonight. Muss is calling the Hogs into the second weekend for a third straight year.
Oh man, Dujuan Harris just went down . Hopefully not bad.
Two hours from tipoff here in Birmingham. A couple pregame reads from Friday. First, Purdue incomprehensibly completing the trifecta of NCAA Tournament flops.

Column on the selection committee handing No. 1 seed Houston a second-round road game. (Apparently this needs to be said for some folks: Final Four is indeed in Houston -- and it was planned years in advance. The B'ham region was seeded Sunday.)
Rick Barnes' best NCAA Tournament win in 20 years? Making the Sweet Sixteen after Zakai Zeigler's injury is a heck of a feat.
Make it 25 today.
Olivier Nkamhoua vs. Texas: 27 points. His average the next 13 games: 9.6. Today vs. Duke: 23 points.
Update: huger. He’s carrying the Vols.
Nkamhoua played the game of his life against Texas. Until now. He’s been huge
Duke bringing back Roach. This is crunch time
Major crisis time for Duke
An ideal first half for Tennessee. Duke on its heels and in foul trouble in a physical slog of a game.
So far, 47.4 percent of Duke's shots are threes. Season average is 35 percent. Tough to get to the rim against Tennessee, and the Devils are settling for some long alternatives.
You knew Tennessee was going to guard like crazy. Making a few shots early has been a bonus. Duke struggling with the Vols' quickness and size.
Plavsic is a hack, and that’s been quickly exposed here.
Furman goes the way of UMBC in 2018 and Ohio in 2021: out, after beating Virginia in the first round as a double-digit seed.
Braden Smith, maybe want to go for that loose ball a little harder?
Oh my god, Purdue
Straight outta Teaneck
It’s early. Very early. But Purdue fans are well within their rights to assume the fetal position.
It’s not that early anymore.
The foul shot that defies physics in Greensboro
Not watching at the moment, so I need to ask: what sort of unconscionable crimes against basketball is Iowa State committing?
Frankly disappointed that Iowa State broke 40. Not sure the last time a team from a power conference scored in the 30s in the NCAA Tournament ... but I do know Wisconsin scored 32 in 1999.
Column: The NCAA Selection Committee shouldn't have given Auburn a homecourt advantage. And it absolutely shouldn't have stuck No. 1 seed Houston with a second-round road game.
Kelvin Sampson, asked if wanted to woo Alabama fans to root against Auburn tomorrow night: “We play Auburn at 6:10, let’s go. … Roll Tide.”
Marcus Sasser: “I’m 100 percent playing tomorrow.” Jamal Shead: “I’m 100 percent going tomorrow.”

Where did Charlie Baker spend some of his first 2 weeks as NCAA president? Capitol Hill. He met with at least 5 US senators, aides tell @SINow . Sen. Blumenthal says Baker brought “definitely a different perspective” than Emmert. “A breath of fresh air.”
Shaka Smart's six-game NCAA Tournament losing streak is over, in emphatic fashion. Marquette rolls into the second round.
Echo chamber in the moment:
Basketball referees are the kings of hands-on talkers. Always putting their hands on each other while conferring.
Riding the biggest homecourt advantage in No. 9 seed history, Auburn has raced to a 21-14 lead on Iowa.

Noted Sunday night that the bottom fourth of the tournament field is one of the strongest we've seen in years, and the top fourth is vulnerable. With a 13 and a 15 winning so far today, the potential for mayhem is being realized.
Two of the top four seeds in Alabama’s region are already out.
Princeton, this year’s Peacocks? The 15th seeded tigers take down Arizona. Wow.
Nate Oats: Brandon Miller is nursing a groin injury since the SEC championship game. Miller was scoreless today.
The Mountain West has won a tournament game.
C of C-SDSU to the wire. Tied with 2:37 left. Bad Cougars shot with a chance for the lead.
Keep an eye on Sacramento: Arizona 31, Princeton 30 at halftime.

Column: Kihei Clark giveth, and four years later he giveth away. If not for the fate-kissed run in 2019, Virginia under Tony Bennett would be the Worst Tourney Program Ever. The evidence keeps piling up.
A flurry from Corpus Christi has cut the Alabama lead to 13 and led to a Nate Oats timeout. If nothing else, they can talk in later years about forcing a Tide timeout.

Alabama freshman football player Tony Mitchell was arrested Wednesday in Florida for a marijuana charge. The passenger of his vehicle also faces a firearm charge after a loaded gun was found in the car without a permit:
Brandon Miller is scoreless at halftime, and it doesn't matter at all. Alabama 54, Corpus Christi 34.
Missouri has won its first NCAA Tournament game since 2010. What a debut season for Dennis Gates.
Really didn't understand Utah State being favored in that game. The Mountain West has now lost its last 10 NCAA tourney games; hasn't won one since 2018.
Brandon Miller was accompanied by armed security today at Legacy Arena (via @ByPatForde )

New: Ranking every team in the NCAA Tournament, 1-68, on their chances of winning it all. From the Tide to Teaneck, two Texas A&Ms, two sets of Owls, brother acts and more. A mere 8,000 words of pithy reading pleasure:
On a night with no college basketball, we can at least read about college basketball. The 1-68 list above, plus ten takeaways from the bracket reveal last night:
No. 45 and No. 65 survived and advanced last night. Who will join them tonight?
March Madness has begun in Dayton. Find out where I slotted tonight’s First Four combatants — and 64 other teams — in my 1-68 ranking of the field.
Also: @CBB_Central on what an expanded bracket would look like if college sports leaders follow through on a terrible idea.
News: USA Swimming is rolling out an ambitious bonus plan to incentivize American relay performance in international competition -- up to $1 million in Paris in 2024.
New: March Madness is all about finding the right underdogs to back. Five double-digits seeds that are solid bets to cover the spread in the first round of the tournament:
Hired Monday. Suspended Tuesday. Outstanding work, McNeese State.
"The athletic director equivalent of a thirsty pic." Good stuff.
You want brackets. We have brackets. A first-run stab at predicting every game of the tournament, from myself and @CBB_Central

pod is live NCAA Tournament Most Intriguing List. Brandon Miller. Bill Self. Painter. Scheyer. Cal. Pitino. Shaka. Kelvin Sampson. And more. Plus: middle finger legal drama and a hero emerges in Canada. @ByPatForde @SandersonRadio @RossDellenger
OK, let's dance.

While we have a few minutes, a GOAT update. In a relatively low-wattage meet in Florida today, @katieledecky broke her own 2017 American and US Open records in the 1650 freestyle. She remains ridiculous.
If Penn State pulls this off …
It did not. The long arm of the Edey blew up the play.

Kansas coach Bill Self discharged from hospital today, per release, which says he arrived March 8 with "chest tightness and balance concerns." He underwent a "standard heart catheterization" and had two stents inserted to treat blocked arteries. "expected to make a full recovery"

Houston certainly misses leading scorer Marcus Sasser so far against Memphis. Also true: Memphis has been on a rampage the last game and a half in this tournament. Tigers could be a scary Big Dance team.

What’s happening with Alabama is an unprecedented moment in sports anthropology. When SHOULD you sit a player? Never? As his biggest opportunity and greatest controversy unfold simultaneously, Nate Oats seems to have his position
Seven months after Pete Carrill's passing, Princeton is returning to the NCAA Tournament for the first time since 2017. He'll run a celebratory backdoor cut in the afterlife for the Tigers.

The IARP has proven to be inept, and maybe that's the gamble. But unless McNeese State has some unknown assurance that Will Wade won't be penalized or five Level I allegations, it is hiring a guy who could be suspended for a full season and/or face a multi-year show-cause penalty

Final five conference tourney finals are this afternoon. Quick accounting on the Forde Minutes picks: 16 of 27 winners correctly selected so far, with three more that could be picked up today; 25 out of 32 picks made the title game. First set of picks:
Second set of picks:
Happy Selection Sunday. Bracket show starts at 6 pm ET. For all the low-seeded dreamers who played their way in, may the power of the Peacock be with you. Maybe this year it’s your turn.
Is the UCLA AD offering an injury update here? https://twitter.com/MartinJarmond/status/1634798013414780928…
text
He's not wrong regarding the Amari Bailey dunk/charge call.
Congrats to MEAC champion Howard, dancing for the first time since 1992.
Mizzou is cooked. Alabama will play either 6 seed Vanderbilt or 2 seed Texas A&M for the title tomorrow.
Bama/Brandon Miller finally making shots, Mizzou missing from deep, and Mizzou is in trouble. It's 50-42 halfway through the second half.

Alabama 44, Missouri 42, 11:28 left. Brandon Miller has eight in the second half, including a three that makes Bama 3-21 beyond the arc. Tide length making it tough for Mizzou to get points in the paint.
Missouri 37, Alabama 36 with 14:48 to play. Tide is 2-19 from three.
Welp. They made it in:
D'Moi Hodge, you cannot be serious! What a catch and running shot from the corner to beat the shot clock, beat the halftime clock and pull Missouri within two. Game on in the second half.
Among the fans in the Mizzou section: Houston Nutt, whose brother Dickie is an assistant on Dennis Gates' staff.
Mizzou has located some offense, is getting out in transition, has cut a 10-point deficit to three, but star player Kobe Brown is down hurt. ... And back up.

Bama 22, Missouri 14. Teams are a combined 2-21 from three. Difference is, not surprisingly, the backboards. Mizzou is among the worst rebounding teams in the country and Alabama has the size to exploit that.
Mizzou 7, Alabama 5 at first TV timeout. Bama is 0-8 from three.
Ready for an unprecedented afternoon of black and gold presence on SEC semifinal Saturday.
Whether they're Bama fans or impostors, do not let them in the arena wearing these shirts.
Saturday speed read in advance of a huge, fun day of college hoops starts here. Forde Minutes First Half:
A news story on Air Force football sanctions:

Column: This is how it's going to be for the rest of the season for Alabama. A warm fan embrace of Brandon Miller, a cold line of postgame media questions, and awkwardly navigating the aftermath of a tragedy.

I know Jerry Stackhouse and Buzz Williams shared SEC Coach of the Year, but this man, anyone @coachdgates ? Mizzou won 12 games last year under Cuonzo Martin, has now doubled that in year one under Gates.
We can't do this all March.
Thick Nick Honor making big shots again for Missouri. Driving layup, deep three, Tigers lead 72-69 with 1:41 left.

Tennessee-Mizzou has been a fun battle, Tigers up one at the last media timeout. Volunteers have hung in there since losing Zakai Zeigler to injury a few games ago; Mizzou handling a pretty heavy UT homecourt advantage here.
I raised the question yesterday, and it's more pertinent now:

Jahmai Mashack bomb three beats the halftime buzzer for Tennessee to take a 33-30 lead into the locker room over Missouri. Kobe Brown playing great (again) for the Tigers with 12 points, three rebounds and two assists.
Here's our story from @RobinsonCarol on Darius Miles and Michael Davis being indicted on capital murder charges in the killing of Jamea Harris:
It's possible that Mississippi State won't score again today.

News story on NCAA violations at Air Force: former assistant football coach Bill Sheridan gets a three-year show-cause penalty, school was previously assessed minor recruiting sanctions in a bifurcated ruling.
A couple guys who know how to win an SEC Tournament — and an NCAA Tournament — right here.

After failing to live up to the hype in 2022, Oral Roberts went back to work and built perhaps the nation’s best mid-major team. On the Golden Eagles’ improved defense, the continuity from 2021’s Cinderella team, and the star that stayed put:

Sources: Former Air Force Academy assistant football coach Bill Sheridan hit by NCAA with a three-year show-cause penalty, as second phase of AFA infractions case comes to an end. School was assessed relatively minor sanctions last September.
Alabama opens SEC tournament play in two hours against Mississippi State. Column from Wednesday, on Brandon Miller's first public comments since being linked to the fatal shooting in Tuscaloosa.
Big East semifinals today: UConn-Marquette and Creighton-Xavier. Column on how the league got its identity back ten years ago, breaking away from football.

Myreon Jones has dropped in two bombs on successive possessions to tie the game at 57 with 36 seconds left. State is a shaky foul shooting team; Gators might be very physical defensively and if you put them on the line, take your chances.
Jones had one more three for the win at the buzzer but couldn't connect. OT. State led by 13 in first half, on the bubble, important five minutes upcoming.
Baylor has seen enough of Iowa State for this season. Three-game sweep for the Cyclones. Bears are 22-6 against the rest of the nation.
Marquette has secured its first postseason win since 2019. The hard way.
New NCAA president Charlie Baker courtside at SEC tournament with commissioner Greg Sankey.
New NCAA era: Baker cheering and applauding on press row for the dance teams performing during timeouts and the SEC Legends being honored at halftime.
Also here: Celtics president Brad Stevens. Still miss him as a college coach.
I liked the pre-edited, "dustbin of history" version. Not often you get a conference commissioner to quote Leon Trotsky.

Bubble updates from last night: Wisconsin looks cooked; Oklahoma State helped itself; Pitt should be fine; Carolina's game today is huge. So far today: Mississippi State and Rutgers have double-digit leads in key games; Michigan on wrong end of a must-win vs. Scarlet Knights.
New detail about what happened the night of the fatal shooting in Tuscaloosa:

pod is live Discussing @RossDellenger interview with Nick Saban. NIL. New Rules. Ewers-Manning Derby is on! Raiola visits USC. Pac 12 should learn from Big East. CFE PSA: Don’t drink Borgs. @ByPatForde @SandersonRadio
From KU: Bill Self not coaching today due to illness.

Column: In a milk run of a press conference in which everyone avoided the words murder, gun, police and investigation, Alabama star Brandon Miller ended his silence. The questions will keep coming in the weeks ahead.
Column: For Jim Boeheim -- and only Jim Boeheim -- Syracuse was Paris. It was Maui. It was his Greek Isle. One man's paradise became a program's treasure.
Don’t look now, but Saint Peter’s has just pulled it’s second straight MAAC tourney upset to reach the semifinals. The birds are … back?
Full Forde Minutes is operational, starting with a First Half of five burning questions heading into Championship Week:
NCAA Tournament broadcast teams have been announced. Jim Nantz's last roundup.
Conference tournament ball has already begun for the day. A-10, Richmond-UMass, 25 more games to follow, five automatic bids going out. Big day.

More college basketball teams should press full court. Because boy howdy there are a lot of them that cannot handle it all. (Looking at you currently, Cleveland State, which has seen a 28-point lead shrink to 11 with 6 minutes left vs. Milwaukee.)
That was an egregious swallowing of the whistle. At a crucial point.
Cougars overcame that officiating malpractice to win and advance. Two WILD semis in the CAA tonight. Charleston-UNCW in the final.
Towson ran a great play for a great look for a great shooter to tie. Just didn't hit it.
Oh my word, Reyne Smith is making it rain for Charleston. I believe he's scored 13 points in five possessions. And he was only really open for one of those shots.

New Forde Minutes First Half: Five burning questions before the brackets come out. Should Alabama win the SEC POY/COY. Officiating Oscar. UCLA/Purdue get a one seed? Can the ACC crack the top 16? Big Ten bubble drama.

Hofstra fortunate to get CAA semifinal into OT vs. UNCW. Oral Roberts is a tussle with Saint Thomas in Summit Semi. Some No. 1 seeds on the brink. Last week's Little Dance preview of those leagues and more:
Current Big Dance card ... Drake: Last NCAA bid was 2021. Fairleigh Dickinson: 2019. UNC-Asheville: 2016. Louisiana: 2014. SEMO: 2000. Furman: 1980. Kennesaw State: Never.
Good for Furman. A year after having bid ripped away by Chattanooga on a buzzer beater, Paladins even the score and earn their first NCAA bid since 1980.
Sun Belt champion Louisiana, dancing. First time for the Ragin' Cajuns since 2014. Bob Marlin has been a consistent winner there.
Hofstra, gone. UNCW makes its second straight CAA final. Take a now, Seahawks.
I have voted. A tradition like no other.
Last shot was originally called a game-winning three, correctly changed to a two. OT.
Drama!!! In the OVC

Fairleigh Dickinson earns the first Big Dance bid, on a technicality. FDU and Merrimack advance to the NEC finals, but Merrimack is ineligible as a DII transitional school. So FDU is in by making the final.
Unless North Carolina can score three more points in the last 44 seconds, it will be held to less than 60 points twice this season by Duke. Wonder if that’s happened before in the shot clock era.
63-57 in Durham, 62-57 in Chapel Hill. Huge for Duke and Scheyer. Heels gotta do a lot in Greensboro next week.
Duke-Carolina to the wire. Again.
Has Texas State become an unstoppable juggernaut? Bobcats entered the postseason 13-18 and have won two Sun Belt tourney games; just beat favored Old Dominion by 29.
Juggernaut update: Texas State takes down Marshall, moves into Sun Belt semis at 16-18.
Hubert has a lineup problem right now.
Antonio Reeves aside, Kentucky-Arkansas has been a mess of a game. Not much composure on display, from officials to coaches to players.
Oscar having a hard time keeping his arms/elbows to himself today.

And a column on the eerily parallel tragic tales involving Alabama basketball player Brandon Miller and Georgia football player Jalen Carter:
Oh dear. The Citadel has 10 points at halftime in its Big South tourney game against Mercer.
Update: Citadel is up to 30 with 8 minutes left. Dare to dream of 40.
Final update: Citadel taps out 41 in a 25-point loss. National championship dreams dashed. Merced’s hopes: still alive!
I wasn’t rooting for the record to be broken, just having some human empathy for Antoine Davis and his father, Mike. Pete Maravich’s scoring brilliance will never touched.
Wrote about this about 10 days ago, when Davis was seriously closing in:
News from UCLA: Chip Kelly signs contract extension through 2027.

As the SEC moves closer to a 9-game scheduling format, Nick Saban tells @SINow that Alabama’s proposed three permanent opponents should be more balanced. “They’re giving us Tennessee, Auburn and LSU. I don’t know how they come to that.”
Ugh, Antoine Davis had a three to tie Pistol Pete’s career scoring record and missed. Game over. Youngstown wins. Davis’ college career ends three points short.
Detroit could buy its way into the CBI postseason tourney and get Antoine the record. So stay tuned.
